classes.name: Pattern
classes.description: A compiled representation of a regular expression. A regular expression must first be compiled into an instance of this class, which can then be used to create a Matcher object.

methods.name: compile

params.name: regex
params.description: The expression to be compiled

returns.description: The compiled pattern

methods.description: Compiles the given regular expression into a pattern.

methods.name: compile

params.name: regex
params.description: The expression to be compiled

params.name: flags
params.description: Match flags, a bit mask of CASE_INSENSITIVE, MULTILINE, DOTALL, UNICODE_CASE, COMMENTS, LITERAL, or UNIX_LINES

returns.description: The compiled pattern

methods.description: Compiles the given regular expression into a pattern with the given flags.

methods.name: matches

params.name: regex
params.description: The expression to be compiled

params.name: input
params.description: The character sequence to be matched

returns.description: True if the entire input sequence matches the pattern

methods.description: Compiles the given regular expression and attempts to match the given input against it. Equivalent to Pattern.compile(regex).matcher(input).matches().

methods.name: quote

params.name: s
params.description: The string to be literalized

returns.description: A literal string replacement

methods.description: Returns a literal pattern String for the specified String. Metacharacters or escape sequences in the input will be given no special meaning.

methods.name: matcher

params.name: input
params.description: The character sequence to be matched

returns.description: A new matcher for this pattern

methods.description: Creates a matcher that will match the given input against this pattern.

methods.name: split

params.name: input
params.description: The character sequence to be split

returns.description: The array of strings computed by splitting the input around matches of this pattern

methods.description: Splits the given input sequence around matches of this pattern.

methods.name: split

params.name: input
params.description: The character sequence to be split

params.name: limit
params.description: The result threshold controlling the number of times the pattern is applied

returns.description: The array of strings computed by splitting the input around matches of this pattern

methods.description: Splits the given input sequence around matches of this pattern. The limit parameter controls the number of times the pattern is applied and therefore affects the length of the resulting array.

methods.name: pattern

returns.description: The source of this pattern

methods.description: Returns the regular expression from which this pattern was compiled.

methods.name: flags

returns.description: The match flags specified when this pattern was compiled

methods.description: Returns this pattern's match flags.

methods.name: toString

returns.description: The string representation of this pattern

methods.description: Returns the string representation of this pattern. This is the regular expression from which this pattern was compiled.

fields.name: CASE_INSENSITIVE
fields.description: Enables case-insensitive matching. By default, case-insensitive matching assumes that only US-ASCII characters are being matched.

fields.name: MULTILINE
fields.description: Enables multiline mode. In multiline mode the expressions ^ and $ match just after or just before a line terminator or the end of the input sequence.

fields.name: DOTALL
fields.description: Enables dotall mode. In dotall mode, the expression . matches any character, including a line terminator.

fields.name: UNICODE_CASE
fields.description: Enables Unicode-aware case folding. When this flag is specified, case-insensitive matching is done in a manner consistent with the Unicode Standard.

fields.name: COMMENTS
fields.description: Permits whitespace and comments in pattern. In this mode, whitespace is ignored, and embedded comments starting with # are ignored until the end of a line.

fields.name: LITERAL
fields.description: Enables literal parsing of the pattern. When this flag is specified, the input string that specifies the pattern is treated as a sequence of literal characters.

fields.name: UNIX_LINES
fields.description: Enables Unix lines mode. In this mode, only the newline character is recognized as a line terminator in the behavior of ., ^, and $.

classes.name: Matcher
classes.description: An engine that performs match operations on a character sequence by interpreting a Pattern. A matcher is created from a pattern by invoking the pattern's matcher method.

methods.name: matches

returns.description: True if and only if the entire input sequence matches this matcher's pattern

methods.description: Attempts to match the entire input sequence against the pattern.

methods.name: find

returns.description: True if and only if a subsequence of the input matches this matcher's pattern

methods.description: Attempts to find the next subsequence of the input sequence that matches the pattern.

methods.name: find

params.name: start
params.description: The index to start searching for a match

returns.description: True if and only if a subsequence of the input starting at the given index matches this matcher's pattern

methods.description: Resets this matcher and then attempts to find the next subsequence of the input sequence that matches the pattern, starting at the specified index.

methods.name: group

returns.description: The matched subsequence as a string

methods.description: Returns the input subsequence matched by the previous match.

methods.name: group

params.name: group
params.description: The index of a capturing group in this matcher's pattern

returns.description: The subsequence captured by the given group, or null if the match was successful but the group failed to match

methods.description: Returns the input subsequence captured by the given group during the previous match operation.

methods.name: groupCount

returns.description: The number of capturing groups in this matcher's pattern

methods.description: Returns the number of capturing groups in this matcher's pattern.

methods.name: start

returns.description: The index of the first character matched

methods.description: Returns the start index of the previous match.

methods.name: start

params.name: group
params.description: The index of a capturing group in this matcher's pattern

returns.description: The index of the first character captured by the group, or -1 if the match was successful but the group failed to match

methods.description: Returns the start index of the subsequence captured by the given group during the previous match operation.

methods.name: end

returns.description: The offset after the last character matched

methods.description: Returns the offset after the last character matched.

methods.name: end

params.name: group
params.description: The index of a capturing group in this matcher's pattern

returns.description: The offset after the last character captured by the group, or -1 if the match was successful but the group failed to match

methods.description: Returns the offset after the last character of the subsequence captured by the given group during the previous match operation.

methods.name: replaceAll

params.name: replacement
params.description: The replacement string

returns.description: The string constructed by replacing each matching subsequence with the replacement string

methods.description: Replaces every subsequence of the input sequence that matches the pattern with the given replacement string.

methods.name: replaceFirst

params.name: replacement
params.description: The replacement string

returns.description: The string constructed by replacing the first matching subsequence with the replacement string

methods.description: Replaces the first subsequence of the input sequence that matches the pattern with the given replacement string.

methods.name: reset

returns.description: This matcher

methods.description: Resets this matcher. Discards all of its explicit state information and sets its append position to zero.

methods.name: reset

params.name: input
params.description: The new input character sequence

returns.description: This matcher

methods.description: Resets this matcher with a new input sequence. Discards all of its explicit state information and sets its append position to zero.

methods.name: lookingAt

returns.description: True if and only if a prefix of the input sequence matches this matcher's pattern

methods.description: Attempts to match the input sequence, starting at the beginning of the region, against the pattern.

methods.name: hitEnd

returns.description: True if the end of input was hit by the search engine in the last match operation

methods.description: Returns true if the end of input was hit by the search engine in the last match operation performed by this matcher.

methods.name: appendReplacement

params.name: sb
params.description: The target string buffer

params.name: replacement
params.description: The replacement string

returns.description: This matcher

methods.description: Implements a non-terminal append-and-replace step. Reads characters from the input sequence and appends them to the given string buffer, then appends the replacement string.

methods.name: appendTail

params.name: sb
params.description: The target string buffer

returns.description: The target string buffer

methods.description: Implements a terminal append-and-replace step. Reads characters from the input sequence and appends them to the given string buffer.

methods.name: pattern

returns.description: The pattern for which this matcher was created

methods.description: Returns the pattern that is interpreted by this matcher.
